newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs end firm after Japan GDP data.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs end firm after Japan GDP data.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen futures ended firmer Friday on late buying after a mid-afternoon drop caused by Japan's higher-than-expected Gross Domestic Product.
March Euroyen slid to a low of 99.04 after the Economic Planning Agency reported that GDP fell a real 0.7 percent in the April to June period from the previous quarter.
"The market came off but volume was very thin. It was mainly the local's selling," said a trader with a U.S. institution.
He added that the larger houses then bought March Euroyen back following the EPA's statement that it hoped the Bank of Japan would maintain its current monetary stance.
"Overall the Euroyen is still very bullish," he said, adding that March looked set to test its high of 99.18 and head towards 99.32 eventually.
The contract finished at 99.12 against a CME close at 99.09 on volume of 10,840 lots. Japanese government bond futures for December settled at 121.40 against their previous 121.26.
Eurodollar futures held onto their overnight gains after the release of a weak Producer Price Index, but activity was practically non-existent ahead of the CPI and retail sales data.
The most active December contract finished at 94.00 against its IMM settlement at 93.99 on 8,515 lots.
"The market has already built in a quarter percent U.S. rate hike. But people are backing off from the expectation that it could be half a percent," said a trader with another U.S. house.
The Federal Reserve is widely expected to hike its funds rate at its policy-setting meeting on September 24, reversing a 14-month string of three cuts, the last of which was in January.
